document.text:
From: 
To: 
Cc: " c 
Subject: RE: out of curiosity 
Date: Thu, 09 Apr 2020 14:33:49 +0000 
Well this is all baffling but I really appreciate knowing it's not just Epstein. Thanks guys. 
From: 
Sent: Thursday, April 09, 2020 10:27 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: Re: out of curiosity 
I got a deadline of next week for a memo the timing of which has no possible significance and for which, I told them, 
some additional things we are working on that cannot be completed by next week could be important. 
On Apr 9, 2020, at 10:19 AM, wrote: 
Yeah suddenly an AMI pros memo became very urgent last week. 
On Apr 9, 2020, at 10:12 AM, wrote: 
To the extent anybody in this small group is willing to share, are any of you folks' teams / cases getting significant 
pressure from the chiefs on memos or other written product this week, whether for the brass or otherwise? I'm just 
curious whether it's just the Epstein case (where we're getting near-daily prodding about imminent deadlines for 
memos that are both extremely time-intensive and also couldn't possibly be acted upon for weeks, given the 
circumstances of the world) or if it's something broader in the unit. I just sent the chiefs a pretty crabby email about 
being bugged daily about lengthy, detailed work product and it made me wonder whether this is a trend or an isolated 
incident. 
More importantly, hope y'all and families are all staying healthy . . . 
Assistant U.S. Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
EFTA00015283
